intro: Guatteria tacarcunae, commonly known as the Tacarcuna guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly in countries like Guatemala and Belize. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
